newsitem.title: USA: Stratosphere says delisted from Nasdaq.
newsitem.headline: Stratosphere says delisted from Nasdaq.

text.p: Stratosphere Corp said the Nasdaq denied the casino/hotel company's appeal of its delisting from Nasdaq.

Nasdaq cited the fact that Stratosphere was in the early stages of bankruptcy proceedings and the uncertainty of the results of the bankruptcy proceedings as reasons for denying the appeal, according to Stratosphere.
The stock was formerly traded under the symbol "TOWVQ". Stratosphere said it anticipates its stock will trade on the over the counter bulletin board.

Stratosphere filed under Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code on January 27, 1997 in Las Vegas. It says it does not believe the bankruptcy filing will, in the long term, hurt daily operations or guest services.
Stratosphere owns and runs the Stratosphere Tower, the 1,149-foot tower with a casino/hotel/entertainment complex centered around the tower.
Grand Casinos Inc owns about 42 percent of Stratosphere.
